website_summaries.verdict: The leather handle adds a rugged touch. Suitable for those who want an authentic-looking hatchet.
pros: Steel holds its edge well and sharpens easily
cons: Leather handle comes with varnish on it that requires special care

customer_reviews.title: Before and After
customer_reviews.text: After receiving this I decided to do as one of the other reviewers said and sand off the varnish on the handle with 100 grit sand paper. I then rubbed Neatsfoot oil on it over the course of about three days. I probably put on about 20-30 coats, so it takes some patience. The results where totally worth it though. I'll add some before and after pictures but the real difference is in how it feels. The handle isn't nearly as slick and feels much more comfortable in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Poor craftsmanship! I was excited to get this pretty axe but upon opening the box i knew i was returning it. There are little chips all along the blade. Description said 14" but mine barely measured 13". The leather handle has defects all over and the clear coat has hairs all stuck to it. Seems like a knock if with Estwing stickers on it. Even the case is a joke, after unbuttoning you have to pull the handle awkwardly through the little opening. I guess you cant rely soley on good reviews. Im going to Home Depot to see what i can find.
customer_reviews.author: Rock&Royalty

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Used this hatchet for less than 20 minutes on one trip for the first time since purchasing. The blade dulled practically instantly (just from cutting wood, no accidental strikes on other surfaces) and the bottom plate is already loose. Unfortunately since I did not go camping shortly after buying it, the return window has passed. Very disappointing since a similar hatchet from the same company has been great for a friend. This one is pathetic and a total waste of money. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Besse

customer_reviews.title: Says made in USA but looks like made in Chinese junkyard
customer_reviews.text: Lots of imperfections. Says made in USA but looks like made in Chinese junkyard. I have owned Estwing tools for decades,all were high quality. If you want this item, buy in a store so they don't send you an ugly tool that you are not proud to give as a gift. I even had to work to file an ugly chip on the cutting edge. No time to send back and still might not get the quality tool I had come to expect from Estwing.
customer_reviews.author: james m.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly used or counterfeit?  There's no way QC passed this hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Estwing hatchet I've purchased and this hatchet can't compare to my previous one. There are two cracks in the ax head and one even wraps around the corner. The handle has dark scuffs all over it and the clear coating is flaking off easily. I also orders the 14 inch Hatchet and it only measures to 12 3/4 inches. Estwing makes great tools but I suggest purchasing one in person to avoid these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle G

customer_reviews.title: Blemishes on the axe’s blade, as shown in attached pictures.
customer_reviews.text: The axe shows unusual brighter ‘shades’ as shown in the attached pictures. In addition, as shown in picture 2, there are cracks. There’s no telling, how deep they might go. It is possible, that those cracks can cause the axe’s blade to shatter. Which could harm bystanders, or yourself! Obviously, the manufacturer, takes advantage of the people that received a faulty product, not sending back the f.... up axe (including myself, due to being too busy).
customer_reviews.author: Neunerball

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality...
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. Rust on back of blade, black paint chipped and sheath is made in Taiwan. Not what you’d expect from a hatchet Made in America. Poor craftsmanship and attention to detail. Additionally, hatchet was shipped in an envelope...
customer_reviews.author: b. smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality Control.  Chips and bubbles on the blade (edge).
customer_reviews.text: Chips and cracks on the blade edge. Some type of bubbled metal melted into the edge as well. Was counting on the good reviews here. Seems company bit off more than they can chew with quality control.
customer_reviews.author: gracious79

customer_reviews.title: Yes, you probably have to ruin the leather sheath to make this work
customer_reviews.text: It's a good hatchet for the cost, but it requires doing some of the work. I held it out of the box and knew within seconds that the leather grip was not going to work for me. I did as other reviewers suggested, which was sanding and treating it to improve handling. I don't really understand the design choice there. The hatchet also came with minor blemishes along the handle and blade, but it wasn't anything that was going to get in the way of using it. I also took a whetstone to it almost immediately and found improved performance. My blade wasn't dull, but it wasn't finely tuned either. Overall, price point met the results.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: GREAT QUALITY-& not SO expensive that you’re afraid to use
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the extra money.GREAT QUALITY-& not SO expensive that you’re afraid to use, GransforsBruk products cost A LOT! But the black looks great,its a good weight(balanced),super sharp,the case does the job, i just used Goo-Gone to clean the places where the stickers were that I pulled off & it didnt mess up the black paint at all - but a tiny amount was on the paper towel-if anyone cares. I am confident you can build a small cabin with this hatchet or battle a 🐻 or 🧟‍♂️ & even just using it to do normal camp stuff, it will preform the way you need it too.might be a heavy option for bug out bags🧐
customer_reviews.author: Adm1

customer_reviews.title: Many years ago...
customer_reviews.text: I was 10 yrs old when I got my first Estwing. That was in 1956. This new one is exactly the same. Beatiful, and built with pride. My first one was used to cut down trees bushes and other offending objects while running through the woods of South Florida. This one is used for chopping kindling for the fire pit in my backyard In Nevads. I will leave it to my grandson for I am sureit will outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: greg braun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I love this hatchet. The leather handle has held up well for me so far...what a nice, classic look it has, too. I've sharpened it several times and it holds an edge nicely. I have split quite a lot of kindling with it (mostly ash, also hemlock for outdoor use). I was kind of hoping for the old USA-made leather sheath, but the nylon one is very solid. As a former Boy Scout and adult Scouter, I am pleased as I can be with this item. Never handle a tool like this without training, and always handle it carefully and safely. (Sorry, I had to add that!)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing repeat customer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this hatchet, So much so that I have 3 of them. One for home. One for my camping gear and one in my hunting stuff. I don’t ever want to forget it at home so I make sure I always have one. I use the one at home ever week or so to make kindling. I have probably used my home hatched 150 times and it will still slice my skin if dragged across it. When and if I lose or break one I will for sure immediately replace it! Great product... don’t trust the bad reviews of people trying to chop oak trees down with it and cut through nails.
customer_reviews.author: MeatDragon

customer_reviews.title: great quality axe, not so much the sheath
customer_reviews.text: The axe holds up to its expectations, its been with me on multiple camping trips and its held its edge. It has a hefty weight for being a small hatchet but it allows it to give some extra swinging power. The sheath on ther other hand is cheapy made and its not made in the us. Its poorly desgined and it is very easy to cut your self when trying to put it on the axe, especially when you try to buckle it shut. If you plan on keeping the axe home and dont need the sheath then get this axe but if you backpack and camp like me, Id wait until they update the sheath. Hope this reveiew helps
customer_reviews.author: Mom to 4 kids

customer_reviews.title: Better than other hatchets
customer_reviews.text: Fells VERY sturdy has a nice grip and isn't overly heavy but also not to light,I am pleased with this and anything I've seen estwing make Also I've seen some comments about how the metal is not even on both sides but the reason for that is because it wasnt made cheap and quick when something like this is perfectly even that means it was eather made in a mold or made by computerized grinding the unevenness shows that it was made by a person rather than a quick and cheap prosses
customer_reviews.author: Big Lug

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced hatchet that serves my needs well. I use it for knocking small limbs off of firewood and hammering wedges in while using a chainsaw to fell or cut up trees. I did as another reviewer did, sand off the varnish (or lacquer) on the handle, and soak it with Fiebing's neatsfoot oil. Much better grip and easier on my aging hands. Stays sharp, and when the time comes, easy to touch up the cutting edge with a Arkansas stone. Only minor downside is the black finish isn't holding up well, but under the conditions I use it for, understandable.
customer_reviews.author: fredstev

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this.
customer_reviews.text: I'd seen some reviews stating that they received their hatchet with a notched blade, suggesting that it could be used/returned or counterfeit, and ordered one anyway, hoping to not be one of those people. Unfortunately, I received mine with small notches on a blade that wasn't very sharp to begin with. I started the return immediately and ordered something else.
customer_reviews.author: Pete T.

customer_reviews.title: Made in America
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made hatchet. The handle is leather with a polymer overlay and sealed. The metal seems to be of good quality and the perfect heavy weight. But the best of all... IT'S MADE IN AMERICA!!!! I don't know about you, but I'm sick of EVERYTHING being made in China. Such pisspoor quality! I'll always spend the extra few pennies for our superior workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: wenracr

customer_reviews.title: Just okay, poor craftsmanship and lacks quality control
customer_reviews.text: The Estwing axe shipped out and arrived on time. Shipped in a plain mailer envelope. I purchased this early to put up as a Christmas gift. It shows in the add 14" It's just shy of 13". There are several grind marks on the blade that look bad. The handle has scratch marks under the varnish and several black marks that look terrible. It cost to much to look this bad when it's new. I would not buy again or would I ever recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SLP

customer_reviews.title: Get Estwing or get nothing
customer_reviews.text: This is the hatchet to have. I have been using Estwing products since my grandfather introduced them to me, and I will always prefer them to other tools. Has a full length steel handle with leather bands. Would be shocked to learn that one broke during normal use. Other hatchets with wooden handles cannot stand up to this one. If you want a hatchet for throwing or camping/bushcraft, save time, money, and frustration and just get Estwing from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Okay axe, not meant for survival.
customer_reviews.text: The axe is alright, craftsmanship is not good however. The leather arrived dried and almost cracked (had to oil and treat it myself), the blade was stained all over and the edge was cracked, I tried to fix it as much as I can but you can still see the cracks. The bottom stamp is somehow loose? I thought it was all one piece steel. Overall, I guess you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Arteaga

customer_reviews.title: Weak steel. Chipped the edge on pine. Also ...
customer_reviews.text: Weak steel. Chipped the edge on pine. Also was not sharp out of the box. Spend a little more for an actual tool
customer_reviews.author: seth witmer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and strong
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my boyfriend. It took him awhile to figure out how to use it well, but he loves looking all mountain man and wearing it around his belt loop when camping. We sharpened the blade right after purchase and sanded off the wonky varnish on the leather handle and applied leather treatment to it. So far its been holding up well the past two months. Just make sure to sharpen when needed.
customer_reviews.author: csywssl

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality but edge was damaged
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this little axe is going to last me the rest of my life. This isn't the first Estwing I've owned. The edge came scraped and dinged, I don't know how this ever passed through Quality Control. Because I know this axe will last me forever, I just sucked it up and cleaned up the edge damage with a stone, but the large scrape is still there. The nylon sheath isn't as terrible as people are saying...I do prefer leather, but this will do. Also, a little elbow grease and vineger will get those pesky stickers off in no time, just a minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: David Simione

customer_reviews.title: Some sort of damaged knock-off.
customer_reviews.text: Showed up damaged. Looks like it could potentially be counterfeit or some sort of Chinese knock-off. Still swings like an axe. Will simply have to do. My recommendation: Go out and buy one in person so you don’t wind up with a faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but small forging flaws in steel.
customer_reviews.text: Small flaws in steel, along sharpened edge. (See my photo.) So I'm concerned the thin sharpened edge may be more prone to chipping during normal use. But I have tools to repair if it does chip. Seems like a forging error. Otherwise, its designed well & seems solid. Leather handle looks nice, but is lacquered. So it is probably going to be slippery if user has sweaty hands, or in rain. Sheath seems well made, thick material.
customer_reviews.author: david b.

customer_reviews.title: It's tough
customer_reviews.text: I put this thing through hell the weekend it arrived. Chopped plenty of wood for a fire while camping, and beat the back of it with another heavy piece of wood to split logs. I was throwing it in to a tree just because and missed more than I hit it, but the hatchet holds up fine. So far I have no complaints other than a small roll where I hit a knot (easily fixed with a concrete and a sharpening puck.) Still sharp, still amazing axe/ hatchet or whatever. 5 stars all day
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Estwing Sportsman's Axe 14 inch Camping Hatcket
customer_reviews.text: I had needed a small hatchet and come across the Estwing brand and thought I would give it a try have used the hatchet many times and holds up well I did put a better edge on the blade with a diamond V knife sharper now it cuts like going thought butter. It's a Estwing product and quality is there would recommend this hatchet to anyone looking for a great hatchet for camping or like me cutting big limbs off trees in our pasture.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT FOR THROWING
customer_reviews.text: im a hobby axe thrower and this handle is cheap and will not withstand the impact of flinging it at targets, id recommend other Eswing Axes
customer_reviews.author: kyle szuman

customer_reviews.title: Well-weighted and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I used this last weekend on a 2 night kayak trip and I was very impressed. It came very sharp and it has enough weight to it that when it strikes wood, it makes a deep cut. I have zero complaints. It also looks great with the nice steel head and multi-toned leather handlewraps. I feel this is a quality product that will last the rest of my lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: J.Wet

customer_reviews.title: A beautiful piece, and Made in the USA! 🇺🇸
customer_reviews.text: I saw a How it’s made on this company. Made me proud. I like it a lot better than my fiskars hatchet, it seems very high quality. It’s a beautiful piece so it’ll make you respect it and take care of it. If I were splitting hairs, I wish the handle wasn’t quite so covered in hard clear coat of some sort. I’d rather oil up the natural leather that it’s made of. But....I love it and it will likely outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: Moosepuck

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this hatchet. It came to my doorstep razor-sharp and ready to go. The case on it is a nice touch, making sure wherever you store it won't get sliced up. I also like the handle, as it feels extremely comfortable to hold and use. Overall, this is a reliable hatchet to keep yourself warm during a camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Z.A. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect and the handle is nice and smooth
customer_reviews.text: How can you go wrong with Estwing? I followed another reviewer's recommedation and sanded the polyurethane coating off of the handle with 100 grit sandpaper then applied Fiebings neatsfoot oil compound to the exposed leather to ensure that it holds up to being exposed to moisture. Worked perfect and the handle is nice and smooth. Used honing oil and honing puck to put a wicked sharp edge on it. I'm sure it will last for years. Very happy with the product and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Baker

customer_reviews.title: The steel is decent and sharpens easily. I've done oak with mine and never had ...
customer_reviews.text: The steel is decent and sharpens easily. I've done oak with mine and never had any chipping or even rolling that couldn't be brought back to shaving sharp within a couple minutes. The hammer face is also well tempered, haven't had any mushrooming or chipping (despite my best efforts). There is some vibration that travels down the handle but what are you expecting from a metal-hafted handaxe? If you're expecting perfection, go shell out >$125 for a Granfors Bruks. This is something for if you don't want to spend a lot of money but still need it to perform.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Piston

customer_reviews.title: bunch of rubbish
customer_reviews.text: handle is NOT leather, but was more like a sticker of leather first hatchet went missing because it was poorly packed handle is NOT solid and instead hollowed out with support rods to use less metal
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moran

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Just know that the way it tapers makes it easy to get stuck into a really hard piece of wood your splitting, but a hammer fixes that quick. A bit awkward with the weight when using for fine shaving but I have no problems whatsoever. Only took me 5 minutes to get a nice sharpen on it, came fairly sharp anyways. I love it to be honest, I got tired of needing to put the head back on my other hatchet, this one is a solid single piece, it does the job and I feel confident in its performance and durability. I know i can rely on it and that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks finish quality
customer_reviews.text: Although it seems to be a solid construction, when delivered there were severa dings in the cutting edge much like other reviews and pictures. It does not have the quality I expected for an American made product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I can't tell if they sent the 12in. or the 14 in.
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet Amazon sent me seems fine although the blade edge is almost totally unsharpened. That okay, I can sharpen it myself. The fit and finish of the hatchet is excellent. No blemishes. My problem is the hatchet is very small. I can't tell if they sent me the 12 in. or the 14 in. size hatchet. I ordered the 14 in. The hatchets are remarkably similar in size. Oh well, it's too much trouble to return so I got a nice (and cheap) small hatchet. Nylon sheath.
customer_reviews.author: grew up in the 1960s

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with scratches and scuffs
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is supposed to be new but it arrived with a bunch of cosmetic problems. Mostly just scratches and scuffs that look ugly. I am going to keep it because functionally, it feels like a very nice hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet. Slippery handle.
customer_reviews.text: Great value hatchet. Main complaint is the leather handle has a lacquer or a similar finish over the leather. Any perspiration or moisture results in a very slippery handle. The finish is a bit of a curious choice.
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Actually kinda dull and "sticky"
customer_reviews.text: Usually, i put the hatchet in a piece of cut firewood, pick up the firewood with the hatchet and hit it against the ground to split that piece of cut wood into kindling. this one takes a LOT of effort to move through the wood , I mean ALOT. It seems well made except for the blade not moving through wood very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thing of beauty
customer_reviews.text: When you get one of these you almost dont want to use it due to how nice they look. But of course it's meant to be used... been using mine for camping. Works great for splitting up some small camp logs, use the back side for setting tent pegs. Fits into my utility bag. The sheath helps keep the edge sharp when in storage and transit. Not had a spot of rust yet, even after leaving the canvas bag it was stored in out during a massive storm while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Tough thin headed Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I really like the thin profile of the head. The previous reviews appear to have been implemented by QC, because I didn't find any of the issues found in previous reviews. I was pleased with the factory edge. I finished sharping (honing really) which didn't take long at all. This is well worth the price. Even if I some day acquire a European carving hatchet; I'll always have a place for this Estwing as an econo axe, because I'll be selective with using any $150-$200 hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Jarhead

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is what a hatchet/ax is supposed to be and dollar for dollar probably one of the best values on Amazon and it's made in the United States. This is a very impressive tool, one solid piece of steel from the blade to the handle. It arrives with a nice leather sheath and a good edge. Because it is solid steel it is a little heavy but there's probably not much you couldn't tackle with this. It is important to remember that tools like a hatchet and knives aren't things you should get at the dollar bin or because they put "tactical" in the name. Spend the extra money get this.
customer_reviews.author: QMG

customer_reviews.title: Just needed a sharpening.
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a sharpening. It's part of my emergency kit for back-roading in my truck that can double as a hammer in a pinch. Feels good in the hand and is the perfect size for tossing in the tool box.
customer_reviews.author: L. Segal

customer_reviews.title: What does a hatchet do actually?
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to look like I knew what I was going at a group camping trip. You can’t split a log with it, don’t try. All I could manage was shaving a big stick for kindling. So that saved my image a little. The rest of its use was relegated to guys throwing it at a dead tree. It excelled at that. Looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Classic light hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Classic design, Proven Staying Power Cons: none Best Uses: Light chopping, kindling splitting: My father had an Estwing stacked leather handle hatchet. I always liked the design and the way it worked. I needed a hammer and, on looking around, found that the Estwing design, from 1923 is still being manufactured. Naturally I bought one, and was so taken with the idea of owning something of such classic and proven design that now I own practically a complete set of Estwing leather handled tools. You can't buy an American made Perfect Handle wrench or screwdriver anymore, but Estwing keeps right on making their striking tools to the same standard as when they designed their original 90 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ray E. Dryden

customer_reviews.title: Nice axe, arrived with slight damage to grip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a fellow fireman. I love Estwing tools and this one is a great little axe. My only issue is it came damaged on the grip. I noticed others have had the same issue so maybe it’s a quality control issue that needs addressed. Other than that it’s a great little axe that seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: Trbo

customer_reviews.title: QA/QC issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful axe - one of the reasons I purchased it, the other being the Estwing name which is synonymous with quality products. When my axe came in the mail I was eager to open it and use it. To my surprise I found a rather dull axe with an uneven grind. Not really a big issue because it was easily fixed but I expected a little better from Estwing quality control. On the other hand, the sheath is pretty decent. I only wish that it came with a nice leather sheath to match the axe handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amażon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor craftsmanship, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I know this is not an expensive piece but it is not sharp at all and where the handle wrappings meet the metal it looks like someone just put it on a grinder or something. I'm disappointed. This is a good name and I was expecting better. You're better off spending the extra money and getting a quality piece. If I just got a bad piece, please feel free to contact me estwing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Tool to Have when Cutting Trees
customer_reviews.text: I needed an axe that could be easily carried into the woods. The cover can be looped through the belt. The Craftsmanship is evident in the use of materials and is well balanced for an axe. Can be used to chip off hard to get limbs or the create an aiming point for an undercut.
customer_reviews.author: TravelmanXS

customer_reviews.title: One day at the scene of the fire.
customer_reviews.text: Little axe cop reference there. I say it because this is close to what I imagine to be the perfect small axe. I have had several over the years but I have never seen one that comes close to the quality of this one. I have absoloutely no complaints except that the blade is a bit dull, but that is easily fixed. I first heard about Estwing tools in the novel unintended concequences. I did not look into them because I figured that the company probably shut down years ago. Or had moved operations to china. Nope, still in operation and apparently cranking out superb equipment. I am looking forward to getting one of their hammers sometime in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hesperus

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: It’s sure looks cool, light and comfortable in hand, but....first time use to cut the bone and it crack, totally disappointed! See pic! I should test it earlier so that I can return it, now it’s too late for me but hope it’s not too late for who read my review!
customer_reviews.author: fatbird

customer_reviews.title: The cover will make you feel inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: The axe itself is fine. The protective cover is designed to drive you crazy trying to figure out how to get it off until you realize you have to slide the axe off inversely by pushing it entirely out of the cover in the reverse direction rather than just pulling the cover off which you can't do at all. One extra snap on the cover would have made it so much easier to undo.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Menlo

customer_reviews.title: Details matter, Estwing
customer_reviews.text: I understand that this is an entry level hatchet that is made for splitting wood, but common estwing details really matter when selling product to the customer. The thing is covered in stickers which are next to impossible to remove. Had to use acetone and isopropyl alcohol to make thing look half decent. No reason whatsoever for something so unnecessary to have been done. The head is covered in scratches and bumps. Again, I understand this is not for winning a beauty contest but all of these little things should've been thought out before presenting product. Taking off one star as two would seem excessive, but boy am i tempted.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this item to friends
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is exactly what I was looking for. It's light, well balanced and came with a sharp edge. I'm seeing lots of critical reviews about scratches and labels on it. There is a clear coating on the entire item. If you sand it lightly you can oil the entire metal to prevent rusting and oil the leather handle. The label glue came right off with goo gone. Any oil will take it off too. I would recommend this item to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Axe
customer_reviews.text: I found it to be plenty sharp right out of the box, but could probably do with a finer edge. I can understand why it would be shipped as it is. The stickers were indeed a bugger to remove - I used a LOT of WD40 to loosen them up and it still took a lot of elbow grease. Not a fan of the sheath - wish it were leather. All in all, it's exactly what I needed and it now resides in my horse trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Nice.  Veeeeerrry nice.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, great design. Nice weight. Nice length. The grip was really well designed and feels good in the hand. It also has good balance overall (not too top heavy). Would have given 5-stars, except that the blade edge had a small chip in it! And being that it was shipped in the sheath, this means that the chip somehow passed through quality inspection and still got sent to the customer. Disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok. 13" long, blade 3.25". Compared to some reviews I didn't get the best one but not the worst. I would pay more if it looked like the pic in the listing.
customer_reviews.author: Justin k

customer_reviews.title: 13 inches not 14, lack of quality control
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet I received was 13 inches from head to handle butt, not 14 as advertised. I guess they make hammers and such over there at estwing and not tape measures. A company that puts the stars and stripes all over their products outta take quality control very seriously. My axe head had several imperfections in it as well as the cutting edge.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: best ever
customer_reviews.text: you can pay more but this is the most durable usefull tool you can ever have. Look at the alaska shows and the all use this brand of axes and hatchets becaust they are indestructable. I have four or five, one is all the vehicles and one on the workbench. Use them al the time. BEST EVER!
customer_reviews.author: Zander von Richtoven

customer_reviews.title: Top shelf
customer_reviews.text: After my first full day of using this and a small hand saw to clear some fence lines I was surprised at how well this hatchet held its edge. I used it to strip foliage and chop 2-3 inch diameter hardwood saplings for fire starter. It also took very little time for me to hone it back to near razor sharpness that evening. It has a nice balanced feel and doesn't want to twist when I swing it. I would buy more as gifts. I'm sure mine will last a long time. Quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Hey You

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet, a bit heavy.
customer_reviews.text: These are quality hatchets. They are not a work of art but a sturdy USA made tool. They are a bit heavy for the capability of a a hatchet but that helps a bit when splitting kindling or other hatchet tasks. Be aware when using a hatchet where your body parts are. They are more dangerous than a full size ax in my opinion. There have been many that gash their legs or feet using hatchets due to the short handle. Keep clear of the blade arc and avoid swinging with too much force. Keep the hatchet sharp to reduce glancing strikes.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Fun

customer_reviews.title: Very quality made, comes and stays sharp!
customer_reviews.text: My new everyday around the property sharp object, cuts great and havent had to do any major sharpening just some quick honing. My only issues are its alittle heavy and the handle is slightly slippery, no grip to the handle. The sheath fits great with a good belt loop. A simple drop in sheath would be cool too tho
customer_reviews.author: stanK

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping, it's heavy duty!! I haven't had the chance to use it yet, but it really seems like good quality. It's a little awkward to get it out of the sheath because you have to take it off over the handle, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA from first class materials.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this axe to take over from the exact same model that I had in 1953. It is the perfect all around axe. It is a bit heavy for a camp axe but worth the extra weight to have one that will hold up and keep a sharp edge.
customer_reviews.author: J. McGurk

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, Poor Labelingz
customer_reviews.text: Hatchet is super solid. Feels great, nice and sharp out of the box. Only issue is they use paper stickers all over it, and even after cleaning they still leave marks. Poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: mr110

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality.
customer_reviews.text: If you want a quality made axe that will probably last a life time this is the one. I have also purchased a double bladed axe, a hammer, and a pick axe from Estwing- all outstanding quality, durability and construction. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and perfect sized
customer_reviews.text: Great axe. It came sharpened and ready to use. Unfortunately my wife saw it as I opened the box and immediately told me not to hack anything with it. It reminded me of my childhood when my mom told me the same thing with my very first axe. The handle is awesome and I’m sure I will love it if my wife ever lets me use the axe out in the wilderness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the cheap $14 hatchet I bought at lowes is better than this hatchet. Use basically every day in the winter to start a fire in my stove. The edge chips easily, rolls easily and needs to be sharpened every 2 weeks. My old hatchet I sharpened every 6-8 weeks. For the money and the brand I expected better
customer_reviews.author: MIke S

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this product to anyone interested in a good quality camping hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight and feel of this hatchet. I basically cut kindling for home and camping and this hatchet is perfect for the job. The blade holds its edge well and can be easily sharpened. I love that is one piece and feels solid in your hand. I agree with a previous reviewer that lightly sanding the handle to remove the light finish and refinishing with an oil based product will preserve the handle and prevent it from getting rot or mold. The original finish will eventually wear and the leather will soak up water like a sponge. Which will cause rot. I would recommend this product to anyone interested in a good quality camping hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Waters Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Two thinks up
customer_reviews.text: I abuse this tool way to much. I would recommend it to anyone shopping for a hatchet. If you have a hard time sharpening tools this one might not be for you. A softer medal like a Fiskar or Gerber may be a better choice. For the price you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: George J.

customer_reviews.title: Great hatchet, annoying sticker to remove
customer_reviews.text: The hatchet itself is really nice. Solid metal head and neck with a great feel to the handle. Only downside is the terrible branding sticker they put on the handle. IT IS IMPOSSIBLE TO REMOVE PROPERLY! Seriously, I had to go find some Go-Gone remover and use it in conjunction with about 10minutes of bristle pad scrubbing. Unfortunately this ended up taking the finish off a portion of the handle with it. Is the hatchet going to fall apart? No. It just feels less smooth than it could be. Wish they put stickers on the metal instead so they could be removed easily.
customer_reviews.author: Locke

customer_reviews.title: the balance is good too. It's very sharp when arrived
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ax. Feels very handy in hand, the balance is good too. It's very sharp when arrived, I chopped down a 2-inches diameter tree with one single swing. I didn't say it's like butter, but it's very easy. Cut a 3~4 inch birch in 4 swings. Like it!
customer_reviews.author: Mr.J

customer_reviews.title: High quality camping tool
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been able to use this a few times, but I did follow the advice by some reviews and blogs and refinished the leather. The tool itself is amazing. I can’t speak to the original grip since I refinished it, but I love the balance and weight. This has worked great for splitting wood at the campground.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice little hammer/ hatchet to use when camping. I've owned Estwing hammers for years so I gave this one a shot. Very nice design and works great. A leather cover would be a nice addition rather than the canvas cover that comes with it. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Tyme

customer_reviews.title: It was a gift and everyone loved it.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift after engraving a design. I was happy with the product and how the engraving turned out.
customer_reviews.author: FastBlue

customer_reviews.title: I paid $20 for an axe dipped in paint
customer_reviews.text: The "special edition" is really just an axe of average quality dipped crudely in black paint. No clear coat, just matte paint that chips off when you remove the sticker. It's uneven on the blade, and there are several spots that bubbled up. Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Solid camping axe
customer_reviews.text: If you want a decent performer without the giant price then this is a good choice. I have had it for a while. You will need to touch up the edge more often. It is a good worker not great. Can't expect a miracle from a small axe after all. Handle feels great in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Q

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is a a solid one-piece forged tool. I use it for removing scrub trees. The handle is beautiful and the blade is sharp. It has a good heft. A fine piece of craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Rwjack

customer_reviews.title: Like? Love.
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL. I was a drifter/homeless/beach bum/hitch-hiker/street musician for years (NOT a drug addict or drunk... I want to clarify) and I spent literally years living in tents in the woods all over the country, save the South-west, and I can tell you, as someone who used various hatchets as part of everyday LIFES routines..... this is a GREAT hatchet. Don't be fooled by the good looks, even though it definitely has that as well.... this thing is designed great. Sturdy, rugged, ergonomic. Well done guys!
customer_reviews.author: The Railroad Bulls

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA since 1923!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and functional, Estwing has been making axes and other tools in the USA since 1923. This was a gift for me and ladies let me tell you, you can’t go wrong giving a guy a tool from Estwing! From the one piece design to the gorgeous stacked leather handle, it just doesn’t get much better than this!
customer_reviews.author: JRO

customer_reviews.title: Sportsman's Axe
customer_reviews.text: Nice Axe , feels lighter than I thought it would ( which is a plus ) , Nice grip hold , cuts well , and I'd buy something made in the USA over China any day !! Fits well in daypack , very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Hatchet
customer_reviews.text: We're using this as a camping hatchet. So basically all we need it to do is hack up some firewood and pound tent stakes into the ground. And this is perfect for those jobs. This thing feels good in your hand. It's well made and sturdy with a nice grip. I've only used it on one camping trip, but I'm confident in the quality of this thing. Provided I don't lose it, I shouldn't have to buy another hatchet for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Stupidjoe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality! Made in USA!!!
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN AMERICA!!! Best hatchet out there. Estwing makes excellent products. I have packed Estwings for almost 40 years. Please use cautio, this ace comes razor sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: American Quality at its finest....
customer_reviews.text: American Quality and lives up to American Made. A great axe, solid and well made. It will last a lifetime and more. It has one "Major" flaw. It rusts very quickly, so oil needs to be applied. I took the bark off a stump and came back a few days later and the blade was completely rusted--it was not outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: (again be careful using it) awesome one and well made
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. I mean "Very' sharp and strong. (again be careful using it) awesome one and well made. with 2lb hammer's help I use it to chop 10" oak fire wood (from back yard and dry for 2~3 years). it works great. I have never had hand Axe that sharp and strong. I really love it. I used it at camping and home fire woods. even use it to take down some wood furniture and tree branches.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: More attractive than functional.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camp axe. Balance is a little to be desired. Handle is attractive but “slippery”
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Cool hatchet for making kindling
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small hatchet for kindling when we roast marshmallows in the backyard. I saw a video about how it was made and I really liked the look of this hatchet, so I had to get one
customer_reviews.author: TrueAggie

customer_reviews.title: Love this hatchet
customer_reviews.text: Love this hatchet!! First, it's MADE IN USA. FYI, I just returned the Schrade 10 - it's a made in China piece of crap with a sheath that EASILY allows the blade to slip out. Very dangerous item. But this ESTWING is a FANTASTIC little axe. Superb quality, CAN BE USED as hammer for tent stakes, etc., perfect leather handle with great balance. Thank you, Estwing! Very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: USA MADE! Can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little hatchets . I buy them for myself and gifts for overseas friends. It’s nice to send them USA MADE tools in a world full of Chinese crap. High quality and last a lifetime. I grew up with one of these and so will my kids.
customer_reviews.author: JeeperJA

customer_reviews.title: good little hatchet
customer_reviews.text: I can see why other reviewers would say these hatchets get passed down from generation to generation. Its well made and lightweight enough to take backpacking, which is why I bought it. I like that the sheath is made from leather. My one complaint would be that it is unevenly made. The edges are a bit sloppy all around. I will probably treat the grip with some oil or other waterproofing agent, just to make sure the leather doesn't get wet and start to separate or shrink. Even if it does, it could be wrapped with paracord and that would be just as comfortable and useful as well. I'm glad I got this hatchet.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T.

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It's pretty.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am trying to buy made in the USA whenever possible. This is a really good little axe. Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Wyzard

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and will last a lifetime
customer_reviews.text: Love it, my old hatchets head wouldn't stay on and instead of wedging it I decided to buy this one. Love that it's a single piece, I haven't used it yet but can tell it's going to be a nice one. It's made great and I feel that I will last a lifetime. Made in the USA!! Also the sheath is not leather but it is made very well too. I would recommend this hatchet to anyone who is looking to get one. It's pretty heavy but imagine that will be a good thing when splitting wood. Over all I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Handy!
customer_reviews.text: Rides in the trunk of my car. What if all of a sudden I must defend myself from an army of nursery saplings? A? Just think!!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander from Houston, TX

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good size, holds edge really well. Used it on a 5 day camping trip and it worked great for chopping up firewood into smaller pieces.
customer_reviews.author: The Hobbits

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money on neatsfoot oil
customer_reviews.text: These are well made hatchets but the leather handles are slippery. I sanded off the clear finish and rubbed in several applications of Sno-Seal with beeswax for a tacky grip that will last for a while. Don't waste your time or money on neatsfoot oil. When it dries, the handle is slippery again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best hatchet. will last forever with all metal handle. annoying sticker to peel off though.
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet. maybe the best. It is really sturdy with the all metal handle. I hope they stop using the annoying sticker though. it takes forever to get rid off and it leaves that stupid residue.
customer_reviews.author: Craig m.

customer_reviews.title: A Hatchet the will last a generation!
customer_reviews.text: Classic american made hatchet. The materials used to make this will last a life time. The price is a littler higher than other hatchet but I promise, once you have this in your hand you won't mind the $5 extra you might have had to pay. I got this as a bachelor party present and it was everything I expected and more. Don't buy a hatchet or axe with any plastic on it!!! Buy this one! Made in the USA and will last long enough to pass down to your kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid hatchet
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is very solid and extremely well made. What else do you expect from something made in the USA? I personally own one of these and I bought this one for our troop. I've chopped through a 5 inch thick log with this once with ease. I like that it is one solid piece of steel. I've used other hatchets where I felt the head might fall off. Not this one. The head is part of the handle so no risk of that happening. This one is a little more expensive than others, but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dale B.

product_meta.title: Estwing Sportsman's Axe - 14" Camping Hatchet with Forged Steel Construction & Genuine Leather Grip - E24A
product_meta.description: Color:LeatherEstwing's world famous Sportsman's axe is the choice of outdoorsmen everywhere. Both the head and handle of the axe are forged in 1-piece and hand polished to a beautiful finish. This classic axe offers unsurpassed balance and temper. It's genuine leather handle is sanded and lacquered for a durable yet comfortable feel. The Sportsman's axe includes a rugged ballistic nylon sheath with belt loop so it can always have your tool close at hand. It has a tempered 3-1/4 in. cutting edge for easy cutting. A must for all campers and outdoorsman alike! Estwing Axes are proudly forged in the in USA using the finest American steel. Please always wear eye protection while using this tool.
feature_bullets: FORGED IN ONE PIECE – The most durable, longest lasting striking tools available
OUTDOOR VERSITILITY – Perfect for chopping logs, small trees & branches or splitting firewood & kindling
HEAVY DUTY SHEATH – Includes ballistic nylon sheath to protect hand sharpened cutting edge. 2.75 or 3.25 inches edge
GENUINE LEATHER GRIP – Hand sanded and lacquered for a durable yet comfortable finish
MADE IN THE USA – Our tools are proudly crafted in Rockford, IL using the finest American steel

specifications.Included Components: Estwing Sportsman's Axe - 14" Camping Hatchet with Forged Steel Construction & Genuine Leather Grip - E24A
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,335 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
